Package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.sources

Class SystemPropertySource

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.TupleProducer
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.ProcessTupleProducer
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.sources.SystemPropertySource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operator
@PrimitiveOperator(description="Submits an output tuple for each Java system property.", comment=" Licensed Materials - Property of IBM (C) Copyright Teracloud ApS 2024, 2024, IBM Corp. 2010, 2016 All Rights Reserved. US Government Users Restricted Rights - Use, duplication or disclosure restricted by GSA ADP Schedule Contract with IBM Corp. ") @OutputPorts(@OutputPortSet(cardinality=1,windowPunctuationOutputMode=Generating,description="Port requiring `name` and `value` attributes representing a system property. Optional `tags` attribute containing tags for the property")) public class SystemPropertySource extends ProcessTupleProducer
Sample source operator using a process() method. Operator that reads the Java System property set and submits an output tuple for each system property. A single output port is assumed with attributes name for the property name, value for its value and tags for a set of tags set from parameters.

The class handles two parameters to provide a simple tagging scheme. This is used to demonstrate parameter handling.
If the parameter tagged is set then any tuple for a system property that starts with tagged's value will have its tags attribute set to the value of the tags parameter.

The parameter initDelay is inherited from the parent class TupleProducer.

This operator provided as the sample Java primitive operator
com.ibm.streams.javaprimitivesamples.sources.SystemPropertySource
in the sample JavaOperators toolkit located in:
$STREAMS_INSTALL/samples/spl/feature/JavaOperators

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception
      Create the non-daemon thread used to call the process() method. The thread is created during initialization to ensure that the SPL runtime will wait upon its completion before completing the operator. The thread is started by startProcessing which means the initial delay support provided by the super-class TupleProducer is honored.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface Operator
      Overrides:
      initialize in class ProcessTupleProducer
      Throws:
      Exception

    • process

      protected void process() throws Exception
      Description copied from class: ProcessTupleProducer
      Sub-classes provide a process() method that submits tuples on the operator's output ports.
      When this method returns the the operator will complete.

      It is guaranteed that the initialize() method happens-before the process() method for purposes of memory visibility.

      Specified by:
      process in class ProcessTupleProducer
      Throws:
      Exception - Exception is sub-class processing
